translation.en: Have you ever wondered what makes things glow?
Today, we're gonna focus on one of my favorites.
translation.es: Veremos una de mis cosas favoritas.

translation.en: Things that are...
fluorescent.
Emily's Wonder Lab
Stay curious and keep exploring
Hey, little scientists, come on in.
- Hi, Miss Emily! - Hello. Welcome!
- - Now, art is pretty cool, right?
Yeah!
But we're not doing art today.
- We're doing science. - Yes!
Yes!
I wish there were a way that we could combine the two.
Ooh. Maybe there is.
Today, we are gonna make our own fluorescent paint.
- Whoa. - That's gonna be fun.
Emily wants us to make fluorescent paint!
Could she be any cooler?
But before we start making fluorescent paint,
translation.es: Pero antes de empezar a hacerla,

translation.en: we just have to turn off the visible light...
translation.es: debemos apagar la luz visible y...

translation.en: - ...and turn on... - Wow!
the invisible lights.
- Cool! - Whoa!
I love everything that glows, so today is my new favorite day.
translation.es: Me gusta el brillo. Hoy es mi nuevo día favorito.

translation.en: Like, it's a dream, but in real life!
translation.es: Es un sueño... pero en la vida real.

translation.en: This isn't just the ground. This is the floor- escent!
translation.es: Este suelo no es común. ¡Es fluorescente!

translation.en: Follow the path on the ground to your stations
translation.es: Sigan el camino a sus estaciones,

translation.en: and get all of your materials,
- then come back to the table. - Let's do this!
I love stuff that glows!
Toys that glow, glow sticks.
Neon T- shirts, signs, lights.
translation.es: Camisetas, letreros y luces de neón.

translation.en: It's like a glow party!
Emily, I wonder, what kind of lights are these?
Ooh, good question, Zaela.
These lights that we are seeing right now are known as black lights,
translation.es: Las luces que vemos ahora son las luces negras

translation.en: and they're emitting a lot of ultraviolet light.
Emily, why do sunglasses say UV protection?
translation.es: ¿Por qué los lentes de sol dicen protección UV?

translation.en: So, UV stands for ultraviolet.
It's protecting you from the ultraviolet light
translation.es: Te protege de la luz ultravioleta

translation.en: that comes from the sun.
It's really, really energetic, but that means that it can hurt our eyes,
translation.es: Tiene mucha energía, puede dañar los ojos,

translation.en: and it can even hurt our skin.
- Sunscreen... - Oh, yeah. ...also has UV protection.
translation.es: El protector solar también tiene protección UV.

translation.en: - That's cool. - I never knew that.
I thought I know everything about science.
translation.es: Pensé que sabía todo sobre ciencia.

translation.en: No, Emily knows more!
Hey, Emily, if UV light comes from the sun,
translation.es: Si la luz ultravioleta viene del sol,

translation.en: then why don't we see it like this light?  That's a very good question, Zaela.
translation.es: - ¿por qué no la vemos así? - Gran pregunta, Zaela.

translation.en: You know the colors of the rainbow?
Red, orange, yellow, green, blue...  Yeah.
translation.es: - Rojo, naranja, amarillo, verde, azul... - Sí.

translation.en: At the end, you have indigo and violet.
Oh.  After violet comes ultraviolet.
translation.es: Después del violeta viene el ultravioleta.

translation.en: Light that we can't really see with our eyes.
translation.es: Una luz que no vemos con los ojos.

translation.en: So black light has ultraviolet light, but it also has a little bit of violet light.
translation.es: La luz negra tiene luz ultravioleta, pero también un poco de luz violeta.

translation.en: That's why we see it as kind of this purply glow.
translation.es: Por eso vemos un resplandor púrpura.

translation.en: - What? - That's so cool.
- Ultraviolet? - Yeah.
It sounds like the name of an alien planet.
It does sound like the name of an alien planet.
So, fluorescents work with ultraviolet light.
translation.es: Los fluorescentes funcionan con luz ultravioleta.

translation.en: The invisible light.
It's really, really highly energetic light.
translation.es: Es una luz con mucha energía.

translation.en: And when it hits the fluorescent paint,
translation.es: Cuando llega a la pintura fluorescente,

translation.en: the fluorescent paint absorbs some of that energy
translation.es: la pintura absorbe parte de esa energía

translation.en: and releases the rest of it with light that we can actually see with our eyes.
translation.es: y libera el resto con luz que podemos ver.

translation.en: - That's cool. So cool. - Cool.
So to see that further,
- I have a ping- pong ball. - Yeah.
Okay, this ping- pong ball is like our ultraviolet light.
translation.es: Esta pelota es como la luz ultravioleta.

translation.en: And pretend that the table is like our fluorescent paint.
translation.es: Supongamos que la mesa es pintura fluorescente.

translation.en: So, the ultraviolet light comes in really fast,
translation.es: La luz ultravioleta llega muy rápido,

translation.en: at the speed of light, with highly energetic particles,
translation.es: a la velocidad de la luz, con mucha energía.

translation.en: and some of the energy is absorbed into the table,
translation.es: Parte de la energía la absorbe la mesa.

translation.en: and some of that energy is released
translation.es: Parte de la energía se libera

translation.en: back to us with light we can see.
translation.es: y llega como luz que vemos.

translation.en: So when the ball bounces back up,
that's the light we see with our eyes.
translation.es: esa es la luz que vemos.

translation.en: Cool!
Yeah. And one ping- pong ball is cool,
translation.es: Sí. Lo de la pelota es genial,

translation.en: but it doesn't really illustrate the entire process,
translation.es: pero no ilustra todo el proceso

translation.en: because that's happening with every single atom inside our fluorescent paint.
translation.es: porque pasa con cada átomo que está en la pintura.

translation.en: And there are trillions and trillions of atoms
translation.es: Y hay billones y billones de átomos

translation.en: - inside the fluorescent paint. - Trillions?
- Trillions? - Whoa!
So instead of one ball, we need tons of them.
translation.es: En lugar de una pelota, necesitamos muchísimas.

translation.en: Science is so fun!
Don't tell Emily, but I'm keeping this one.
translation.es: No digan nada, me quedaré esta.

translation.en: Pink is my favorite color.
Yeah!
When all those ping- pong balls were coming down,
that was like the highly energetic rays of ultraviolet light,
translation.es: eran como los rayos de luz ultravioleta

translation.en: and when they bounced back up,
that's like the spectacular parade of photons
translation.es: era como un desfile de fotones

translation.en: that we see as different colors of light.
translation.es: que vemos como luz de distintos colores.

translation.en: That is so cool.
Emily makes science fun.
translation.es: Con Emily, la ciencia es divertida.

translation.en: Ping- pong balls and glow- y stuff?
Wait a minute, is this a surprise birthday party for me?
So, you guys ready to make some fluorescent paint yourself?
- Yeah! - Okay.
Get your mixing bowls ready,
we're gonna create three different colors of fluorescent paint.
translation.es: Haremos tres colores de pintura fluorescente.

translation.en: These are the insides of highlighters...
translation.es: Esto es el interior de los resaltadores.

translation.en: ...which contain chemicals that are fluorescent.
And so you want to take the color of your choice
and start pouring a little bit of water over the top
translation.es: y viertan un poco de agua encima

translation.en: while you squeeze it.
Look how that glows in the light.
translation.es: Miren cómo brilla en la luz.

translation.en: Can I combine colors?
- You can combine colors. - Whoa! This is about experimenting.
- Do whatever you want. - Yeah!
The other thing you want to do
is we're gonna do a little scoop of cornstarch,
translation.es: es agregar un poco de almidón de maíz

translation.en: just to thicken up our paint.
- All right? - Oh, my fingers are glowing!
- Your fingers are fluorescent. - Cool!
Oh, my gosh. - Look at Nathan's face! - Whoa!
Your face is fluorescent.
- Really? - Yeah!
We're glowing! We're glowing!
I'm glowing! I'm glowing!
Ooh, this experiment makes me so happy.
The messier, the better!
I feel like a scientist.
Oh, no!
No!
I put too much in.
Oh, don't worry about it.
- Science is all about trial and error. - Oh, you're right.
translation.es: La ciencia es ensayo y error.

translation.en: We're gonna add more cornstarch to thicken it up.
Look how much this is glowing.
This is amazing.
- Scientists, are you ready to go paint? - Yeah!
Okay, take your materials and let's go over to our canvas.
translation.es: Tomen sus materiales y vamos al lienzo.

translation.en: - Whoo- hoo! - Yeah!
Okay, guys. Wow.
Look at that.
It is gonna be a masterpiece.
I love painting. It's all over my hands and my hair.
translation.es: Me gusta pintar. Me pinté las manos y el cabello.

translation.en: - I'm going to paint my nails green! -
It's awesome!
Remember, art is all about exploring new boundaries.
translation.es: Con el arte, exploramos nuevos límites.

translation.en: And art and science is about expressing yourself.
translation.es: Con el arte y la ciencia, nos expresamos.

translation.en: So, put down those paintbrushes,
and put your body into it.
These kids are glowing in the dark
translation.es: Los niños brillan en la oscuridad

translation.en: They're glowing in the dark, yeah Glowing in the dark
translation.es: Brillan en la oscuridad, sí Brillan en la oscuridad

translation.en: They're glowing in the dark
These kids are glowing in the dark They're glowing in the dark, yeah
translation.es: Los niños brillan en la oscuridad Brillan en la oscuridad, sí

translation.en: Science is messy, and I'm all about messes.
How do they do it?
How do they glow?
- Did they eat some magic nachos? - One more.
Yeah!
Glowing on their skin And on their clothes
translation.es: Su piel y su ropa brillan

translation.en: I look a mess!
I bet Emily knows
Why those kids are glowing in the dark Glowing in the dark, yeah
translation.es: ¿Por qué los niños brillan en la oscuridad?

translation.en: Glowing in the dark They're glowing in the dark
- - Okay, little scientists,
translation.es: Brillan en la oscuridad Bien, científicos,

translation.en: today we learned all about ultraviolet light,
translation.es: hoy aprendimos sobre la luz ultravioleta,

translation.en: fluorescent paint, and all about how to combine art
translation.es: la pintura fluorescente y cómo combinar arte

translation.en: with science.
And remember, stay curious...
And keep exploring!
Emily's Wonder Lab
Stay curious and keep exploring
For today's at- home experiment,
we are going to make our very own lava lamp using the power of density.
translation.es: haremos una lámpara de lava con el poder de la densidad.

translation.en: Now, remember, all kid scientists need a grown- up's approval.
translation.es: Recuerden: necesitan la aprobación de un adulto.

translation.en: So, for this one, you need a little bit of water, a glass, like this,
translation.es: Necesitan un poco de agua, un vaso como este,

translation.en: some vegetable oil,
salt,
and to go with the theme of the day, we have some phosphorescent powder
translation.es: y por el tema de hoy, tenemos polvo fosforescente y luz ultravioleta.

translation.en: and a UV light,
translation.es: tenemos polvo fosforescente y luz ultravioleta.

translation.en: because we wanna make our lava lamp glow.
translation.es: Queremos que la lámpara de lava brille.

translation.en: So, the first thing you wanna do
is fill your glass most of the way
translation.es: es llenar casi todo el vaso

translation.en: with water.
And then, you wanna add your vegetable oil.
So, if we watch what happens here, watch closely,
translation.es: Miren bien lo que pasa aquí.

translation.en: because the vegetable oil is rising to the top.
That's because vegetable oil is less dense than water.
translation.es: Es porque es menos denso que el agua.

translation.en: It's lighter than water, so it rises to the top.
translation.es: Es más liviano, por eso sube.

translation.en: Now, to start our lava lamp effect, we have some salt here.
translation.es: Para el efecto de lámpara de lava, tenemos sal.

translation.en: Salt is heavier than water,
so it's gonna wanna fall to the bottom.
So when I add it here, you can see what happens.
translation.es: Cuando la agrego aquí, verán qué sucede.

translation.en: It's grabbing onto the molecules in the oil, and taking down some of that oil with it.
translation.es: Se adhiere a las moléculas del aceite y se lleva un poco del aceite.

translation.en: But once it gets down to the bottom,
the salt dissolves in water,
translation.es: la sal se disuelve en el agua,

translation.en: and you can see the oil starts rising to the top again.
translation.es: y ves que el aceite vuelve a subir.

translation.en: And we're seeing that same effect that we had before.
translation.es: Vemos el mismo efecto de antes.

translation.en: But we want to make it glow, right?
So let's add some phosphorescent powder.
And we're gonna make this glow really bright orange.
translation.es: Haremos que tenga un brillo naranja.

translation.en: Mix, mix, mix, mix.
Okay, so, now, all we need is our UV light
so we can see this glow in action.
translation.es: para ver el brillo en acción.

translation.en: Look at that, that worked so well!
And the fun part about this
is that you can do this again and again.
translation.es: es que pueden hacerlo muchas veces.

translation.en: And look at that, look how cool that is.
translation.es: Miren. Miren qué genial que es.

translation.en: That is how you make your very own glowing lava lamp.
translation.es: Así pueden hacer su lámpara de lava.
